p.draft-comment: The following IgnoreControlChar-row is used in Configuring a - Directory, File Tail, Kafka Consumer, Kinesis Consumer, JSON Parser, Log Parser:]

row.entry: Removes all ASCII control characters except for the tab, line feed, and carriage return characters.

p.draft-comment: ORIGIN rows - ProduceSingleRec is used by Kafka Consumer and MapR Streams Consumer. MaxBatchSize and BatchWaitTime rows are used in Configuring Kafka Consumer, JMS Consumer. See if they should go anywhere else.
Charsets are used by message and file origins. But Directory Charset is standalone.

row.entry:
For each partition, generates a single record for records that include multiple objects.
When not selected, the origin generates multiple records when a record includes multiple objects.

Maximum number of records processed at one time. Honors values up to the maximum batch size.
Default is 1000. The default is 1000.
Number of milliseconds to wait before sending a partial or empty batch.

Character encoding of the messages to be processed.
Not used for all data formats.

Character encoding of the files to be processed.
Not used for all data formats.

p.draft-comment: The following rows are used in the Data Collector Console - Overview,

strow.stentry: Provides context-sensitive help based on the information in the panel.

p.draft-comment: The following row is used in Configuring Hive Streaming and Configuring JDBC Producer

entry.p: Use to override the default field to column mappings.
By default, fields are written to columns of the same name.

p.draft-comment: The following table is used in full for the Amazon S3 origin and the Amazon S3 destination reuses individual rows. Data Format and File Compression are also used in Directory.

row.entry:
Optional folder where the data resides. If used with a file name pattern, acts as a root folder for the file name pattern and any directory included in the file name pattern.
To read data from more than one folder, use glob patterns to represent the directory structure in the file naming pattern.

Delimiter used by Amazon S3 to define the directory structure.
Default is slash ( / ).

entry.p: Regular expression that describes the pattern of the file names to process. You can use UNIX-style wildcards, such as an asterisk or question mark. For example, *.log.
To process data in more than one folder, you can include the path to the files to be processed and use wildcards to define glob patterns.

row.entry:
Maximum buffer size. The buffer size determines the size of the record that can be processed.
Decrease when memory on the machine is limited. Increase to process larger records when memory is available.
Default is 128 KB.

The compression format of the files:
None - Processes only uncompressed files.
Compressed File - Processes files compressed by the supported compression formats.
Archive - Processes files archived by the supported archive formats.
Compressed Archive - Processes files archived and compressed by the supported archive and compression formats.

entry.p: Number of records to pass through the pipeline at one time. Honors values up to the Data Collector maximum batch size.
Default is 1000. The Data Collector default is 1000.
Number of seconds to wait before sending a partial or empty batch.

row.entry:
Data format for source files. Use one of the following formats:
Avro
Delimited
JSON
Log
Protobuf
SDC Record
Text
XML

Character set to use when writing files.
Not used with all data formats.

Character set to use when writing data.
Not used with all data formats.

p.draft-comment: table-JDBCAdvProps - JDBC Consumer uses the whole table, Producer uses all rows but last.

row.entry:
The maximum number of connections to create.
Default is 1. The recommended value is 1.

The minimum number of connections to create and maintain. To define a fixed connection pool, set to the same value as Maximum Pool Size.
Default is 1.

Maximum time to wait for a connection. Use a time constant in an expression to define
        the time increment. 
Default is 30 seconds, defined as follows:
         ${30 * SECONDS}

Maximum time to allow a connection to idle. Use a time constant in an expression to
        define the time increment. 
Use 0 to avoid removing any idle connections.
Default is
         30 minutes, defined as follows: ${30 * MINUTES}

Maximum lifetime for a connection. Use a time constant in an expression to define the
        time increment. 
Use 0 to avoid removing any idle connections.
Default is 30
         seconds, defined as follows: ${30 * SECONDS}

Creates read-only connections to avoid any type of write.
Selected by default. Clearing this property is not recommended.

conbody.draft-comment: table-S3AdvProps Amazon S3 origin/destination use the whole table, Kinesis Consumer uses all rows but the first.

row.entry: Specifies whether to use a proxy to connect to Amazon S3.
